dict.string: Tap the highlighted button
Tap twice to set the marker
Tap to continue
Professor, welcome to the Console. Cool interface, isn't it? I hope you like it because you'll spend the next few weeks using it while drinking coffee
The Console shows you data collected by satellites deployed around the planet.
The mission takes place within this landscape. It is full of features, from the highlighted arid region to forests rich in resources.
You can press the goal icon to show a summary of the environment at any time.
These are your bots. The circle shows the area where we have deployed a small starting population.
This first mission has one dispersal goal. You should drive your bots to the blinking hexagon in your bottom right.
Tap the Play button to see what your bots are doing.
The bots move, reproduce and die on their own, but you can guide them using some cool tools.
The first one is the orientation marker. Tap twice in any place of the map to suggest the dispersal direction.
The second one is the evolution track. You begin with 10 EvoPoints and receive additional points during the mission.
EvoPoints are used to increase the three attributes. Tap the button to spend 1 EvoPoint and upgrade Mobility to Level 2.
Reproduction controls the fertility of your bots. Move it to level 2.
Each change of an attribute costs 1 additional EvoPoint, as highlighted in yellow. Increase it to 3.
Tap again to set Reproduction to 4.
Increasing Resistance improves the survival skills of your bots. Spend the remaining points on this attribute.
Use the remaining 2 EvoPoints to increase Resistance again.
Deployment finished! Let's see if the bots survive with these traits.
This panel shows how your population is increasing. You should often check it to detect collapses
Now set the orientation marker within the goal zone.
As you can see, you received additional EvoPoints here. Good luck!
Some missions have more than one goal as shown at the top of the Console.
The bright area shows the timeframe within which your population must complete the goal, according to archaeological evidence. If you arrive before or after this timeframe, the mission will fail.
The best arrival time is highlighted here.
If you feel that the game is too slow you can increase its speed in the Options menu. Good luck!.
Welcome, Professor. You will use a new tool in this mission.
The technical term is Temporary Augmentation of Population Attributes Through Bursts in Cultural Traits.
The team just calls them Boosts.
You can spend EvoPoints to activate them and temporally increase an attribute.
The first one increases Reproduction. Tap it now.
The second Boost increases Resistance and it has an area of effect. You need to tap and drag towards the area that you wish to improve.
Boosts have a cooldown period so use them wisely. Good luck!
The first Goal of this mission is to check the size of your group.
You need to reach the size highlighted in this panel within the assigned timeframe.
You will need to collect different resources to pass this mission.
This mountain has plenty of minerals useful to your group.
This forest can provide plenty of wood.
Collect resources by moving to these areas and increasing your Exploitation attribute.
You can tap here to cycle through the resources collected and the amounts needed.
Both resources will deplete with exploitation, but if you are careful woods will recover over time.
You have a new attribute for this mission: Trade.
If you develop this skill, your bots will be able to exchange one resource for goods owned by nearby groups.
You wonâ€™t be able to collect enough minerals before the time is up, so you will need the attribute to succeed.
We have integrated all domestication techniques under the concept of Terraforming.
This area here is rich enough to be transformed into cultivated land by increasing this skill.
Your population will thrive in terraformed areas, but you will need to reach it before this can happen.
